climbs.name: Tyler's B-Day
climbs.fa: Dean Potter (solo) 2004  Equipper: Clay Frisbie, Tyler Moore 2010

content.description: Take a committing step onto the wall from the back of the boulder, or traverse around from the left to gain the first bolt.  A big move pushes through the crux and past 2 more bolts to the shared anchor.
content.location: On the back side of the boulder.  The short arete just right of Cracked Rib, and a few feet left of TNC Forever.

content.description: Sharp, thin holds take you to the second bolt.  More comfortable holds lead the last few, slightly overhanging feet to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts to 2 bolt anchor shared with Tyler's B-Day.
content.location: Back side of the boulder.  Left of Starboard List, right of Tyler's B-Day.

content.description: Splitter handcrack on the backside of the Titanic boulder.
Arete on the uphill southern end of the block

The vertically challenged traverse right from Cradle of the Deep while taller climbers may wish to jump to the first good hold on the overhanging arete.  Hard moves off the ground flow into more relaxed climbing to the top.  Originally done on gear.
content.location: To the left of Portside and right of Cradle of the Deep. The left end/arete of the boulder.

content.description: This climb has some of the most interesting climbing at Horse Shoe Canyon Ranch.  The well protected crux comes low at the first bolt where one utilizes whatever they can to get around the small roof.  Slightly easier, but continually interesting climbing leads to the anchors.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: A shallow dihedral located to the right of the striking arete, Cradle of the Deep.

content.description: Climb past some thin holds near the second bolt and follow jugs to the anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The bolted line between the arete (Squirrel Deck) and the dihedral (Port Side).

content.description: Located on the Titanic's prow. Cradle follows the steep and sharp arete through some fixed chains to a two bolt anchor. A couple draws may be necessary and it is wise to stick clip the first bolt as the ground drops away another 15 feet or so when you pull onto the route.
A one move wonder up a short face.  The move is long and may be height dependent.
content.protection: Three bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the face of the Titanic boulder which faces the standard approach trail.  This route is on the opposite side of the boulder as Craddle of the Deep.

content.description: Good jams to the base of the roof.  You can pull the roof using the loose plates, but it seems better to traverse to one side or the other and clip bolt anchors.  The good part of the climb is the crack.
content.protection: Gear to #3 or #4 Camalot.  If traversing to anchors, watch for the swing if you come off.  The PG is more for the topout, though.
content.location: This is the crack splitting the uphill side of the boulder.

content.description: A very large boulder that has some bolted and trad routes on it.  The view from the top out is one of the best.
